### Addressed Previous Review Comment: Automatic Cleanup for TTS Jobs

This pull request successfully addresses the previous review comment regarding the lack of an automatic cleanup mechanism for TTS jobs stored in the Durable Object.

The `TTS_DURABLE_OBJECT` now implements a Time To Live (TTL) of 2 hours (`TTL_IN_MILLISECONDS = 7200000`) for stored TTS job data. This is applied when a job is stored via the `/store` endpoint:

```javascript
await this.storage.put(jobId, new TTSJob(jobId, totalChunks, audioChunks, mimeType), { expirationTtl: TTL_IN_MILLISECONDS });
```

This ensures that old TTS job data will not accumulate indefinitely, preventing potential storage issues and improving resource management. This is a significant and well-implemented improvement.
